inclusion.criterion: apartment can accommodate the device EzyGain
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: evaluation of accessibility of home by EzyGain team
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: first visit takes place on site with investigator/APA investigator and an investigator
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: evaluation of spontaneous physical activity by actimetry for seven days + QAPPA
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: beginning of training phase on the device
inclusion.label: unknown
met
inclusion.evidence: 41 years old, but no upper limit mentioned

inclusion.criterion: availability at home during their participation period
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patient with a volunteer close caregiver to participate in the study and receive training from investigator/APA investigator
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: person who would like to train more regularly in the walk and at home because unable to get out
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: patient affiliated with a Social security plan
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: person who has a partial limitation of walking activity and in whom, re-education of walking is relevant to improve performance
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: impossibility of installing the device at home
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: severe cognitive impairment with risk of using the device alone, outside of instructions
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: absence of a caregiver to follow a continuous training of the physiotherapist/APA investigator to supervise independently one or two sessions per week
exclusion.label: met

notes: Patient has itchy foot with localized scaling and maceration between third and fourth toe. Diagnosis is Tinea pedis infection confirmed by observation of segmented fungal hyphae during microscopic KOH wet mount examination.
